document.heading: District of Columbia Unemployment Compensation Act Second Amendments Act of 1984

history.narrative: Law 5-124, the “District of Columbia Unemployment Compensation Act Second Amendments Act of 1984,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 5-454, which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 10, 1984, and September 12, 1984, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 1, 1984, it was assigned Act No. 5-177 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
